Rifampin is a classical example of a drug asked about on pharmacology examinations, indeed because of its Cyp effects. There's many drugs affected by Rifampin in this way due to this Cyp-related drug-drug interaction. The thing that stresses me the most is that I see 3rd year medicine students not getting it right on examinations in 3 or 4 terms repeatedly. Pretty worrying if these are to become future MDs though... There's a bit less room to 'learn on the job' in healthcare if you don't get your pharmacological interactions right in theory...
